quotes.quote: Puberty, it has been said, is everyone's first experience of a sentient madness.
Going through puberty as a young girl is so confusing. This monster invades your body changes things and makes things grow and no one tells you what's going on.
Adolescence is a new birth, for the higher and more completely human traits are now born.
Adolescence is the age of cosmic yearnings and private passions, of social concern and personal agony. It is the age of inconsistency and ambivalence.
Adolescence is like cactus.
Adolescence as the time when an individual recapitulates the savage stage of the race's past.
Adolescence in our culture for a young woman, for a girl, is a hard road.
Growing moustache and beard is the sign puberty, not maturity.
Puberty for a girl is like floating down a broadening river into an open sea.
Before puberty the child's personality has not yet formed and it is easier to guide its life and make it acquire specific habits of order, discipline, and work.
Adolescence represents an inner emotional upheaval, a struggle between the eternal human wish to cling to the past and the equally powerful wish to get on with the future.

Adolescence has been recognised as a stage of human development since medieval times long, long before the industrial revolution and, as it is now, has long been seen as a phase which centers on the fusion of sexual and social maturity. Indeed, adolescence as a concept has as long a history as that of puberty, which is sometimes considered more concrete, and hence much easier to name and to recognize.
Puberty brought them together. Maturity drove them apart.
Adolescence is society's permission slip for combining physical maturity with psychological irresponsibility.
Adolescence is a plague on the senses.
Adolescence is the conjugator of childhood and adulthood.
The age of puberty is a crisis in the age of man worth studying. It is the passage from the unconscious to the conscious; from thesleep of passions to their rage.
Adolescence is just one big walking pimple.
Adolescence is perhaps nature's way of preparing parents to welcome the empty nest.
Most of us have had that experience at around puberty of realising that, despite whatever efforts we put into our chosen sports, we will become at best competent.
Adolescence is when girls experience social pressure to put aside their authentic selves and to display only a small portion of their gifts.
